snippet: The decision by President Xi Jinping to investigate the former head of the domestic security apparatus is the first time that such a high-level official has been the focus of a formal corruption inquiry.
abstract: Pres Xi Jinping of China authorizes corruption inquiry against powerful former head of domestic security apparatus, Zhou Yongkang, pressing antigraft crusade to new level; decision marks first time since founding of the People's Republic of China that an official from the highest echelon of the Communist Party has faced such scrutiny.

byline.original: By JONATHAN ANSFIELD and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The decision by President Xi Jinping to investigate the former head of the domestic security apparatus is the first time that such a high-level official has been the focus of a formal corruption inquiry.

headline.main: China Focusing Graft Inquiry on Ex-Official
headline.print_headline: China Focusing Graft Inquiry on Ex-Official

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (Communist Party of China)
